intro: Cyrtandra squamulata, commonly known as the squamulata Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with lance-shaped leaves and a woody stem. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Cyrtandra squamulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
